alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 18 at 6:28AM MDT until April 19 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING TUESDAY NOON TO 9 PM MDT FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT CURRY AND ROOSEVELT COUNTIES DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH WEDNESDAY MID MORNING UNTIL MID EVENING FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .West and southwest winds will become strong Tuesday and to a lesser degree Wednesday, as humidities plummet. Along with an unstable atmosphere and well above normal temperatures, this will lead to widespread critical fire weather conditions which are likely to return daily in many areas through the end of the week. In addition, widespread poor humidity recovery is expected Tuesday night. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 9 PM MDT Tuesday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Much of northern, central, and western NM Tuesday afternoon until mid evening, and Wednesday from mid morning until mid evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...On Tuesday, west and southwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 mph. On Wednesday, west and southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph, except up to 50 mph near Clines Corners. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...For Tuesday, 8 to 14 percent. For Wednesday, 5 to 10 percent. Widespread poor humidity recovery Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
